definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: The force of the explosion broke all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸力把所有窗子都震碎了。

sentences.english: The UK claims to have reduced the total explosive power of its nuclear arsenal by 75%.
sentences.chinese: 英國稱已經減小了其核武器爆炸力的75%。

sentences.english: Such was the coerces of the access that all the windows were torn.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸力這麼大，所有的窗戶都被震碎了。

sentences.english: The air erupted into a blurred sphere of explosive force.
sentences.chinese: 空氣噴發成一個爆炸力的模糊球體。

sentences.english: The penetrative and explosive force that China has in facing globalization is enormous.
sentences.chinese: 中國對全球所具有的穿透力和爆炸力都是巨大的。

sentences.english: The explosive power of the bomb was the greatest ever used in terrorist attack.
sentences.chinese: 在恐怖分子襲擊所用的炸彈中這顆的爆炸力最強。
這種鞭炮的爆炸力極強。

sentences.english: The shopping center took the full force of the blast.
sentences.chinese: 購物中心承受了全部爆炸力。

sentences.english: This kind of firecracker boasts great explosive force.
sentences.chinese: 這種鞭炮的爆炸力極強。

sentences.english: The blasting force could be so strong that the cold lattices are impelled into the domain for damage.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸力是如此的強烈以致於造成冷晶格的傷害。

definition: no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
